scripts.say: The Sakura Empire Combined Fleet's Naval Exercises were about to conclude with Nagato's congratulatory speech.
Ladies and gentlemen, I am proud of all the people that participated in our Naval Exercise!
Both teams of Red and Blue, lead by Amagi and Kaga, respectively, fought very well throughout the entire event!
As there were no significant differences in their technique, size, or equipment, the only thing that determined the victor was their tactics...

The Combined Fleet will treasure the experience it was able to get from this year's wargames, such as the mastery of their guns and torpedoes and experience working with team formations different from what they are used to.
I want you to leverage these skills and to be ready for war with the Sirens or any other foreign power.
Now, in regards to the candidate for the next Combined Fleet flagship...
When the appropriate time comes, I will delegate my powers to the Amagi-class battlecruiser, Amagi!
Amagi, you should be prepared for an important duty, a duty rivaling that of a Sakura Empire shrine maiden, a duty passed down from Mikasa-sama's days!
Nee-sama... will be the Combined Fleet's next flagship...!
Akagi was so overjoyed that she burst into tears.
Lastly, there is one more thing I have to tell you.
I have received some news that are rather sudden even for me, so I have not had much time to absorb it...
In an instant, Nagato's tone of voice became heavy.
As we all know, our battle against the Sirens many decades ago was won by investing an outrageous amount of resources into our military.
But we were not the only ones who did so. In order to create a ubiquitous lifeline of blue across the ocean, all major powers had to pay an equal price for this shared victory...
And so, now that the Sirens have been temporarily repelled and we have recovered our strength, the admiralty of all factions have held a discussion and settled on a Treaty.
The Eagle Union, Royal Navy, Sakura Empire, Iris, and Sardinia have already signed it... In fact, most of the admiralty of all major powers that were in the great war have.
The factions are preventing one another from achieving total supremacy while simultaneously striving for a balance of power and saving energy on the upkeep of their fleets.
They say that everyone "must downscale their navy by an agreed-upon amount."
...I was just as astonished as you all are.

In essence, this means that from now on the construction of new capital ships is not permitted, and construction of them that is already underway must be halted. A lucky few may be converted to a different type of ship, but the rest won't ever be completed.
And any ship that did not meet the Treaty's terms must be...
...scrapped.
